module.name: class_of_containment_of_product
module.keywords: module, containment, class, product, process plant

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module that records classes of containment between classes of product.
The nature of a containment relationship between individual products may be specified by indicating a class of containment of which it is a member.

ul.li: the class of product 'pressure vessel'; and

example.p: that indicates a gas can be contained under pressure in a pressure vessel, is a class_of_containment_of_product.
At an instant in time, the cardinality for this relationship is follows:

ul.li: a pressure vessel contains zero (when empty), one (usual) or many (mixed) batches of gas;
a batch of gas is contained in zero (when dispersed), one or many pressure vessels.

example.p: The containment relationship between tank T_27 and batch of gas 2001-10-30/B2 can be classified as a 'containment under pressure'.

note.p: The cardinality for the relationship is within the scope of the Cardinality_of_relationship application module.

li.p: a mapping between one class of product and another that indicates the nature of a containment relationship between two individual products.

li.note: Containment of individual products is within the scope of the Containment_of_individual_product application module.

li.p: membership of a class of containment.
li.note: Membership of a class of containment of product is within the scope of the Product_structure_and_classification application module.

uof.name: Class_of_containment_of_product
uof.description: The Class_of_containment_of_product UoF identifies a class of containment of product and defines the class of product that contains and the class of product that is contained.
